commit_message:
Add NUMATopologyFilter in case of dpdk

According to openstack documentation for hugepages
flavor it is required to add NUMATopologyFilter. So
I added this filter to default ones and created dpdk.yaml
in values_overrides for dpdk case.

Change-Id: Icd93827d0f12946ebf5d1964f0941f3c2f56e78f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/31/761731/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: conf: nova: filter_scheduler: enabled_filters: "RetryFilter, AvailabilityZoneFilter, RamFilter, DiskFilter, ComputeFilter, ComputeCapabilitiesFilter, ImagePropertiesFilter, ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter, ServerGroupAffinityFilter, NUMATopologyFilter"

subject: [ceph] Fixed a bug in custom storage classes definition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-21 19:35:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/d5da500c23f33bd0a87e722d6291c73ae5d906fa', 'message': '[ceph] Fixed a bug in custom storage classes definition

The original code overrides the list of monitors with ceph monitors defined
in [global] section of ceph.conf even if monitors are explicitly enlisted
in storage class parameters. This allows to use the only one ceph cluster with
all storage classes.

Patch set fixes this issue by using the monitors from [global] section of
ceph.conf as a 'default' value, only if the 'monitors:' parameter is not explicitly
set in the storage class definition.

Ex.
      storageclass:
        rbd:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: general
          parameters:
            pool: rbd
<...>

In this case is used the monitor list from [global].

      storageclass:
        rbd-custom:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: rbd-custom
          parameters:
            monitors: ceph-mon.cluster.localdomain:6798
            pool: rbd
<...>
In this case the value from storage class will be used.

Change-Id: Idcd0c3df849c3a7e5fc8853ecbb932e1626baffc

commit_message:
[ceph] Fixed a bug in custom storage classes definition

The original code overrides the list of monitors with ceph monitors defined
in [global] section of ceph.conf even if monitors are explicitly enlisted
in storage class parameters. This allows to use the only one ceph cluster with
all storage classes.

Patch set fixes this issue by using the monitors from [global] section of
ceph.conf as a 'default' value, only if the 'monitors:' parameter is not explicitly
set in the storage class definition.

Ex.
      storageclass:
        rbd:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: general
          parameters:
            pool: rbd
<...>

In this case is used the monitor list from [global].

      storageclass:
        rbd-custom:
          provision_storage_class: true
          provisioner: "ceph.com/rbd"
          metadata:
            default_storage_class: true
            name: rbd-custom
          parameters:
            monitors: ceph-mon.cluster.localdomain:6798
            pool: rbd
<...>
In this case the value from storage class will be used.

Change-Id: Idcd0c3df849c3a7e5fc8853ecbb932e1626baffc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/35/753135/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: [ceph-client] This patch set fixes several issues and extends the functionality for the function wait_for_pgs()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-30 19:05:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/28c5b6ef01dde00a225794112fd51f9675a60364', 'message': '[ceph-client] Extending functionality and fixing bugs for the function wait_for_pgs ()
Both list for critical and acceptable PGs states were moved to values.yaml and now could be
configured by customer.
[helm-toolkit] Added template joinListWithSeparator which alows to convert a yaml list into
a separated string with given eliminator.
Example of use:
--------------
values: |
  test:
    - foo
    - bar
usage: |
  {{ tuple "&" .Values.test | include "helm-toolkit.utils.joinListWithSeparator" }}
return: |
  foo&bar

Change-Id: I26b8bb5eeaaf23c076b954807a11425db69d1dc3

Change-Id: I26b8bb5eeaaf23c076b954807a11425db69d1dc3
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2020-10-07 23:24:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/1e30d1f2fee873a17c3ef46bdc349ecb407c8d70', 'message': '[ceph-client] This patch set fixes several issues and extends the
functionality for the function wait_for_pgs()

The original version of the function can fail if the Ceph cluster is in
is doing a rebalance or simply working under high load, being in fact
absolutely healthy. However, the deployment may fail because not all PGs
are in active state at the time of check.
The cluster definitely will do a rebalance if the autoscaling gets 
triggered for some reason. Those is expected Ceph behavior, but
can make the deployment fail.

To prevent these types of false negatives, the wait_for_pgs() function
was significantly improved and now monitors two different sets of states
- critical and acceptable.

Both list for critical and acceptable PGs states are located in
values.yaml and could be configured by a customer.
The wait_while_autoscaling() function was
added to the patch set to exclude possible autoscaling interference with
the PGs status check.

Also the service template joinListWithSeparator was added to the 
[helm-toolkit]. This template alows to convert a yaml list into
a separated string with given eliminator. Below is an example of use.

Example of use:
--------------
values: |
  test:
    - foo
    - bar
usage: |
  {{ tuple "&" .Values.test | include "helm-toolkit.utils.joinListWithSeparator" }}
return: |
  foo&bar

Change-Id: I26b8bb5eeaaf23c076b954807a11425db69d1dc3
'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2020-10-07 23:32:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/5e41bab9f3d451534ed31b8738c9a25195593712', 'message': '[ceph-client] This patch set fixes several issues and extends the

commit_message:
[ceph-client] This patch set fixes several issues and
extends the functionality for the function wait_for_pgs()

The original version of the function can fail if
the Ceph cluster is doing a rebalance or simply
working under high load, being in fact absolutely healthy.
However, the deployment may fail because not all PGs
are in active state at the time of check.
The cluster definitely will do a rebalance if 
the autoscaling gets triggered for some reason.
This is expected Ceph behavior, but can make the
deployment fail.

To prevent these types of false negatives,
the wait_for_pgs() function was significantly
improved and now monitors two different sets of
states - critical and acceptable.

Both lists for critical and acceptable PGs states
are located in values.yaml and could be configured
by a customer.
The wait_while_autoscaling() function was added
to the patch set to exclude possible autoscaling
interference with the PGs status check.

Also the service template joinListWithSeparator was
added to the [helm-toolkit]. This template alows
converting a yaml list into a separated string with
given eliminator. Below is an example of use.

Example of use:
--------------
values: |
  test:
    - foo
    - bar
usage: |
  {{ tuple "&" .Values.test | include "helm-toolkit.utils.joinListWithSeparator" }}
return: |
  foo&bar

Change-Id: I26b8bb5eeaaf23c076b954807a11425db69d1dc3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/72/755372/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This section describes different ceph palcement group statuses # Some of them could be mentioned as critical and must trigger an error # and abort of the deployment because the infrastucture is in unrecoverable # error state, while the second group should allow the latter deployment # primaraly because these states appear with autoscaler on and these # states do not affect the overall ceph performance pg_critical_states: # List of critical PGs states - down - recovery_unfound - backfill_unfound - incomplete - inactive - stale - backfill_toofull - recovery_toofull - failed_repair - laggy pg_acceptable_states: # List of critical PGs states - active creating - premerge - peer - recovering - backfill_wait - remapped - backfilling - activating - wait # End of changes

[WIP] Add "TMOUT" parameter for pods in the openstack namespace

Include "TMOUT" parameter to automatically log users out of bash
sessions after a period of inactivity.

commit_message:
Prevent errors in get_active_endpoint function

Sometimes "endpoints_dict" var can be evaluated to None
resulting in "TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable"
error. This patch catches the exception while getting
list of endpoints and checks the value of
endpoints_dict.  Also the amount of active endpoints is being logged
for debug purposes.

Change-Id: Id91ed601bfa091a86fc2b330ef85ee3fbd42ceac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/69/716569/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: endpoints = k8s_api_instance.read_namespaced_endpoints( name=endpoints_name, namespace=pod_namespace) except kubernetes.client.rest.ApiException as error: logger.error("Failed to get mariadb service with error: {0}".format(error)) raise error active_endpoints = [] if endpoints_dict['subsets']: active_endpoints = [s['addresses'] for s in endpoints_dict['subsets'] if 'addresses' in s ][0] logger.info("Amount of active endpoints: {0}".format(len(active_endpoints))) logger.info("Amount of active endpoints: 0")
deleted_lines: endpoints = k8s_api_instance.read_namespaced_endpoints( name=endpoints_name, namespace=pod_namespace) addresses_index = [ i for i, s in enumerate(endpoints_dict['subsets']) if 'addresses' in s ][0] active_endpoints = endpoints_dict['subsets'][addresses_index]['addresses']

commit_message:
[ceph] be more paranoid in scripts about uninitialized variables

looking at logs it seems some scripts run in certain ways by accident
because of use of uninitialized variables

start looking at what simple things we can do to catch some of this

Change-Id: I14cc5a8ef9256e729f70daa69620401500eac6f9

commit_message:
heat: fix auth_uri setting

auth_uri should really be pointing at the _public_ endpoint
for Keystone, not the internal one as per the documentation.

This is important to get a successful Magnum cluster to deploy.

Change-Id: If0807fbe1e3c9076abc93ff0bae0283cdc5bf96e

commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by tox-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's tox-constraints.txt

Change-Id: Ic9fa7a042d35e2f741eaf64d75759b7acd31da9b

(deperecated) and the www_authenticate_uri should be properly set to the

commit_message:
magnum: Resolve missing configurations

This patch adds a few missing configurations in order to make the latest
release of Magnum work with OpenStack Helm.  The `keystone_auth` section
is necessary for the 'communication' across services, the auth_uri
(deperecated) and the www_authenticate_uri should be properly set to the
public endpoint (so that services can talk to Magnum cleanly) and the
regions for the clients should match the one that Magnum is running in
within a multi-region environment to avoid cross-region requests when
they are not requested.

It also fixes magnum-conductor to allow it to rollout on configuration
changes.

Change-Id: Ib22375aa818e7954f97f7623300642b18e697519
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/28/763028/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Moving job_db_sync and job_ks_endpoints to dynamic deps

The patch moves job_db_sync and job_ks_endpoints from static to
dynamic dependencies to make it possible to disable these manifests.

Change-Id: Ib436fcc5fe76e6d2a32a83dfcaa4b6399acbee6a

This patch set will implement the grafana metrics related changes
required for kubernetes version upgrade to 1.16. Updates are mostly
specific to cadvisor metric labels. It is to make sure all
existing metrics are scraped and available in Prometheus so that
these can be consumed by Grafana & Nagios.

commit_message:
Moving jobs definitions from static to dynamic deps

The patch adds ability to move a definition from static to dynamic
section because of the fact that in some cases users and
credentials for OpenStack services had been created in RabbitMQ
before deployment of the OpepnStack chart for an service. Values is going
to have the below structure. cinder-rabbit-init, job_storage_init and
job_backup_storage_init  could be moved from static to dynamic section.
Example structure is below:

values:
  dependencies:
    dynamic:
      job_rabbit_init:
        api:
          jobs:
            - cinder-rabbit-init

Change-Id: I645371522ea3063f0657e77a40a90a0c518f7b8e

added_lines: {{- range $key1, $dyn_dep := tuple "job_rabbit_init" "job_storage_init" }} {{- if and (index $envAll.Values.manifests $dyn_dep) (hasKey $envAll.Values.dependencies "dynamic") -}} {{- if hasKey $envAll.Values.dependencies.dynamic $dyn_dep -}}{{- $_ := include "helm-toolkit.utils.merge" ( tuple $envAll.Values.__kubernetes_entrypoint_init_container.deps ( index $envAll.Values.pod_dependency ) (index (index $envAll.Values.dependencies.dynamic $dyn_dep) $component) ) -}}{{- $_ := include "helm-toolkit.utils.merge" ( tuple $envAll.Values.__kubernetes_entrypoint_init_container.deps ( index $envAll.Values.dependencies.static $component ) (index (index $envAll.Values.dependencies.dynamic $dyn_dep) $component)) -}} {{- end -}}
deleted_lines: {{- if and ($envAll.Values.manifests.job_rabbit_init) (hasKey $envAll.Values.dependencies "dynamic") -}} {{- if $envAll.Values.dependencies.dynamic.job_rabbit_init -}}{{- $_ := include "helm-toolkit.utils.merge" ( tuple $envAll.Values.__kubernetes_entrypoint_init_container.deps ( index $envAll.Values.pod_dependency ) (index $envAll.Values.dependencies.dynamic.job_rabbit_init $component) ) -}}{{- $_ := include "helm-toolkit.utils.merge" ( tuple $envAll.Values.__kubernetes_entrypoint_init_container.deps ( index $envAll.Values.dependencies.static $component ) (index $envAll.Values.dependencies.dynamic.job_rabbit_init $component)) -}}

subject: keystone: do not delete secrets on deploy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-12 20:27:15.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/templates/secret-fernet-keys.yaml', 'keystone/templates/secret-credential-keys.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/228bdb3684ff1732fb480fb2d111563a1cec8190', 'message': 'keystone: do not delete secrets on deploy

The default hook-delete-policy for Helm is before-hook-creation[1]
which corresponds to "Delete the previous resource before a new hook
is launched (default)".

This will result in the secret being wiped on every deploy, the solution
in here is to switch it to `hook-failed` which maps to "Delete the
resource if the hook failed during execution" -- however, given that
this is a secret, it will never 'fail', keeping that resource untouched.

[1]: https://helm.sh/docs/topics/charts_hooks/#hook-deletion-policies

Change-Id: Id6a8115e52a08f0618d9252b3264999272272725
'}]
commit_message:
keystone: do not delete secrets on deploy

The default hook-delete-policy for Helm is before-hook-creation[1]
which corresponds to "Delete the previous resource before a new hook
is launched (default)".

This will result in the secret being wiped on every deploy, the solution
in here is to switch it to `hook-failed` which maps to "Delete the
resource if the hook failed during execution" -- however, given that
this is a secret, it will never 'fail', keeping that resource untouched.

[1]: https://helm.sh/docs/topics/charts_hooks/#hook-deletion-policies

Change-Id: Id6a8115e52a08f0618d9252b3264999272272725
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/75/762575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Ceph-rgw, if gc takes too long for cleanup. You can try this as override values as ceph parameters commented.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-07-09 14:53:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/51d6a97a80877649e87aa5475b1d5a04326646f5', 'message': 'Using ceph-rgw glance store takes too long to cleanup, even after deleting.
The default is 2hours and that needs to be adjusted otherwise, this image store fills up quickly.
Also note that, ceph makes three copies per pool by default.

Having these suggested values will cleanup in 5 to 10mins as compares to 2 hours.

Reference: https://docs.ceph.com/docs/nautilus/radosgw/config-ref/

rgw gc obj min wait

Description
The minimum wait time before the object may be removed and handled by garbage collection processing.

Type
Integer

Default
2 * 3600

Change-Id: Iddb981c602b70f4433336b8a6dae7cb7b8083839
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-07-11 02:51:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/f7b049d3b6c9a04d54cfbd890b0eb56940d162f9', 'message': 'Ceph-rgw gc takes too long for cleanup.

The default ceph-rgw object store gc runs every two hours.
Thats too long, considering new OS glance images can fillup
space in two hours. Also ceph by default makes makes
three copies and that adds up to the space consumption in
ceph-rgw pool backend.

Adding these rgw_gc parameters will help run gc to reduce
the cleaup interval. Here is the reference to ceph parameters:
https://docs.ceph.com/docs/nautilus/radosgw/config-ref/

rgw_gc_obj_min_wait: The minimum wait time before the object
may be removed and handled by garbage. Default: 2 * 3600.

rgw_gc_processor_max_time: The maximum time between the beginning
of two consecutive garbage collection processing cycles.
Default: 3600.

rgw_gc_processor_period: The cycle time for garbage collection
processing. Default: 3600.

Change-Id: Iddb981c602b70f4433336b8a6dae7cb7b8083839

commit_message:
Ceph-rgw, if gc takes too long for cleanup. You can try this
as override values as ceph parameters commented.

The default ceph-rgw object store gc runs every two hours.
Thats too long, considering new OS glance images can fillup
space in two hours. Also ceph by default makes three
copies and that adds up to the space consumption in
ceph-rgw pool backend.

Adding these rgw_gc parameters will help run gc to reduce
the cleaup interval. Here is the reference to ceph parameters:
https://docs.ceph.com/docs/nautilus/radosgw/config-ref/

rgw_gc_obj_min_wait: The minimum wait time before the object
may be removed and handled by garbage. Default: 2 * 3600.

rgw_gc_processor_max_time: The maximum time between the beginning
of two consecutive garbage collection processing cycles.
Default: 3600.

rgw_gc_processor_period: The cycle time for garbage collection
processing. Default: 3600.

Change-Id: Iddb981c602b70f4433336b8a6dae7cb7b8083839

commit_message:
[nova] Switch to helm-toolkit.utils.daemonset_overrides_root

The patch switch neutron daemonsets to use overrides daemonset_overrides_root

  values:
   overrides:
     nova_compute:
       labels:
         override::me:
           root:
             override_root_option: override_root_value
             conf:
               neutron:
                 DEFAULT:
                   foo: bar

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761028/

Change-Id: Ib7b919949e0b1625ea6ce5ad90ef2350dbdc96df

subject: [helm-toolkit] add daemonset_overrides_root function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-02 22:08:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/35948976a44d71c69de955f4ca1d9993c9db9261', 'message': "[helm-toolkit] add daemonset_overrides_root function

The helm-toolkit.utils.daemonset_overrides function have some limitations:

 * it allows to override only conf values specifid in configmap-etc
 * it doesn't allow to override values for daemonsets passed via env variables
   or via damoenset definition. As result it is impossible to have mixed
   deployment when one compute is configured with dpdk while other not.
 * it is impossible to override interface names/other information stored in
   <service>-bin configmap
 * It allows to schedule on both hosts and labels, which adds some
   uncertainty

This implementation is intended to handle those limitations:

 * it allows to schedule only based on labels
 * it creates <service>-bin per daemonset override
 * it allows to override values when rendering daemonsets

 It picks data from the following structure:

 .Values:
   mychart_mydaemonset:
     labels:
       override::me:
         root:
           override_root_option: override_root_value
           conf:
             ovs_dpdk:
               enabled: true
             neutron:
               DEFAULT:
                 foo: bar

Change-Id: I133e07f759111cd8f568c49fd78ed0f7ed8435e5

commit_message:
[helm-toolkit] add daemonset_overrides_root function

The helm-toolkit.utils.daemonset_overrides function have some limitations:

 * it allows to override only conf values specifid in configmap-etc
 * it doesn't allow to override values for daemonsets passed via env variables
   or via damoenset definition. As result it is impossible to have mixed
   deployment when one compute is configured with dpdk while other not.
 * it is impossible to override interface names/other information stored in
   <service>-bin configmap
 * It allows to schedule on both hosts and labels, which adds some
   uncertainty

This implementation is intended to handle those limitations:

 * it allows to schedule only based on labels
 * it creates <service>-bin per daemonset override
 * it allows to override values when rendering daemonsets

 It picks data from the following structure:

 .Values:
   overrides:
     mychart_mydaemonset:
       labels:
         override::me:
           root:
             override_root_option: override_root_value
             conf:
               ovs_dpdk:
                 enabled: true
               neutron:
                 DEFAULT:
                   foo: bar

Change-Id: I133e07f759111cd8f568c49fd78ed0f7ed8435e5

commit_message:
[Mariadb] Add role controller

This patch adds mariadb controller that is responsible to mark one
ready pod as mariadb_role: primary to forward all traffic to it.
This will allow to drop nginx ingress controller which adds extra
hops between client and server and uses heavy customized nginx templates.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752677/

Change-Id: I3b29bc2029bfd39754516e73a09e4e14c52ccc99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/79/752679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python3 import logging import os import sys import time import pykube MARIADB_CONTROLLER_DEBUG = os.getenv("MARIADB_CONTROLLER_DEBUG") MARIADB_CONTROLLER_CHECK_PODS_DELAY = int( os.getenv("MARIADB_CONTROLLER_CHECK_PODS_DELAY", 10) ) MARIADB_CONTROLLER_PYKUBE_REQUEST_TIMEOUT = int( os.getenv("MARIADB_CONTROLLER_PYKUBE_REQUEST_TIMEOUT", 60) ) log_level = "DEBUG" if MARIADB_CONTROLLER_DEBUG else "INFO" logging.basicConfig( stream=sys.stdout, format="%(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(name)s %(message)s", datefmt="%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", ) LOG = logging.getLogger("mariadb-controller") LOG.setLevel(log_level) def login(): config = pykube.KubeConfig.from_env() client = pykube.HTTPClient( config=config, timeout=MARIADB_CONTROLLER_PYKUBE_REQUEST_TIMEOUT ) LOG.info(f"Created k8s api client from context {config.current_context}") return client api = login() def resource_list(klass, selector, namespace=None): return klass.objects(api).filter(namespace=namespace, selector=selector) def get_mariadb_pods(): sorted_pods = sorted( resource_list( pykube.Pod, {"application": "mariadb", "component": "server"}, "openstack" ).iterator(), key=lambda i: i.name, ) return sorted_pods def ensure_mariadb_role(pod, role): if pod.obj["metadata"]["labels"].get("mariadb_role") == role: LOG.debug(f"Nothing to do, pod's {pod.name} role is {role}") else: pod.obj["metadata"]["labels"]["mariadb_role"] = role pod.update() LOG.info(f"Set pod {pod.name} role to {role}") def is_ready(pod): if pod.ready and "deletionTimestamp" not in pod.metadata: return True def main(): while True: has_ready = False for pod in get_mariadb_pods(): pod.reload() if has_ready is False and is_ready(pod): ensure_mariadb_role(pod, "primary") has_ready = True else: ensure_mariadb_role(pod, "backup") LOG.debug(f"Sleeping for {MARIADB_CONTROLLER_CHECK_PODS_DELAY}") time.sleep(MARIADB_CONTROLLER_CHECK_PODS_DELAY) main()

commit_message:
postgresql: Restore audit user creation capability

The postgresql chart used to create an audit user. [0]

When patroni was removed, this functionality went away. [1]

This change restores the ability to create the audit user and set its
password. This happens during pod startup, just after the admin password
is set.

0: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680081/
1: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/723053/

Change-Id: I5cd1c774e75fde5b7e3f1634c5cc6e06239b3fc8

commit_message:
Switch to quay.io/airshipit/kubernetes-entrypoint

There are a few Charts which still used the Stackanetes
entrypoint, this updates them to make them all use the
same one.

commit_message:
Add a condition for systemd service detection in monasca_setup

Skip agent service detection if only installing plugins.
This will make it possible to use monasca-setup on the environments
 where monasca-agent is not running as systemd service.
Typical usecase is running agent on kubernetes.

Change-Id: I232506e19f593b43cc011c6499242847c9bbc108
(cherry picked from commit a8be13bdeb84bd11019f8e0010985181115cc73a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/89/811789/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Skip agent service detection if only installing plugins if not args.install_plugins_only: # Detect and if possibly enable the agent service agent_service = detect_init(PREFIX_DIR, args.config_dir, args.log_dir, args.template_dir, username=args.user, name=args.agent_service_name)
deleted_lines: # Detect and if possibly enable the agent service agent_service = detect_init(PREFIX_DIR, args.config_dir, args.log_dir, args.template_dir, username=args.user, name=args.agent_service_name)

commit_message:
[Cinder] Mount rw working directory /var/lib/cinder

Mount /var/lib/cinder from host to cinder-backup, cinder-volume
container to allow store its temporary data.

Change-Id: I99640612e8b1ebb30c8b8a01c096ad02784d7c85

commit_message:
[memcached] Enable memcached ingress-controller & ingress-error-pages

Adopt the 'active / backup' strategy of ingress in mariadb chart to solve similar bug

Change-Id: I051c60a101008f913b620fa3e91a637897bd8d1f
Closes-Bug: #1858171

commit_message:
Add registry authentication support

Add the default values for the oci_image_registry endpoint which holds
information to build the dockerconfigjson secret enabling authentication
on the registry.
A new secret is also added with a manifest to generate it.

Change-Id: I267b55d737c18c87083c23b1a740b3bb1b6b6b9d
Implements: blueprint support-oci-image-registry-with-authentication-turned-on
Depends-On: Id9fca020c351683c25ebe83d65e3da2c779bd9b6

metadata agent. Nodes labeled with 'dvr' and 'snat' will host

[neutron] Add DVR support

With DVR feature enabled in neutron l3 and metadata agents
will be deployed on compute nodes.

commit_message:
[ceph] Add custom storage class

Change-Id: Ib108f35802bf3c05cc29bbe84b170db36f805548
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/81/752281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: custom-storage-class: provision_storage_class: true provisioner: ceph.com/rbd ceph_configmap_name: ceph-etc metadata: default_storage_class: false name: custom parameters: pool: rbd_custom adminId: admin adminSecretName: pvc-ceph-conf-combined-storageclass adminSecretNamespace: ceph userId: admin userSecretName: pvc-ceph-custom-client-key imageFormat: "2" imageFeatures: layering

commit_message:

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/25/751625/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {{- if .Values.ceph_client.external_ceph.rbd_user }} - name: EXTERNAL_CEPH_CINDER_USER value: "{{ .Values.ceph_client.external_ceph.rbd_user }}" {{ end }} {{- if .Values.ceph_client.external_ceph.configmap }} - name: external-ceph-etc mountPath: /etc/ceph/external-ceph.conf subPath: external-ceph.conf readOnly: true {{ end }} {{- if .Values.ceph_client.external_ceph.user_secret_name }} - name: external-ceph-keyring mountPath: /tmp/external-ceph-client-keyring subPath: key readOnly: true {{ end }} {{- if .Values.ceph_client.external_ceph.configmap }} - name: external-ceph-etc configMap: name: {{ .Values.ceph_client.external_ceph.configmap }} defaultMode: 0444 {{ end }} {{- if .Values.ceph_client.external_ceph.user_secret_name }} - name: external-ceph-keyring secret: secretName: {{ .Values.ceph_client.external_ceph.user_secret_name }} {{ end }}

commit_message:
Run compute-kit on changes to relevant charts

This commit runs osh compute-kit job on changes to helm-toolkit,
mariadb, openvswitch, memcached, libvirt and rabbitmq charts.

Change-Id: I93f56c98548dcf9f36140a0e14b9a76eeca3c528
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
[neutron] decrease cache expiration time for metadata agent

Metadata agent caches results of port queries to neutron server.
Ports are queried by IP address and network id.
Default expiration time is 600 seconds.
600 seconds is quite a long time, and IP address might be already
reused by another port/VM - this leads to issues with getting
metadata.
The patch suggests to set expiration time to 30 seconds by default.

Change-Id: I3607eeb46e2af3dcdeb92f985f7ad190f47ab486

commit_message:
Creating predefined users,perms,vhosts in rabbitMQ

The aim of the patch is to create predefined users which are
going to be used by OpenStack services or any other purposes
with their vhosts and permissions at start up stage through
defintion.json file.

Change-Id: I15f646f4f0df4e7b181aabe044a2ed8ad5fd5163
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/93/670493/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cannot manage ironic nodes after re-deploying ironic chart

Ironic-conductor saves all pxe data for each ironic nodes.
Theses files are needed to manage the ironic nodes.
However ironic chart mounts this pxe directory into
an emptyDir option, therefore these pxe data would be
removed in case of re-deployment of ironic chart.
We need to have an option for saving the pxe data in a persistent.

Change-Id: Id204e46f525bcb25494bbaf6c4bb496b3cc5097f
Story: 2007751
Task: 39940

commit_message:
Add generic-health-probe to helm-toolkit

There are various of services that are checked by eestablished connections
to Rabbitmq and Database. The patch adds generic probe to perform those
checks.

Change-Id: Ic5a1017565c9e989f0f973ecb590086090abc0d9
Related-Prod: PRODX-3456
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/06/716306/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright 2019 The Openstack-Helm Authors. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """ Health probe script for OpenStack agents that perform generic openstack service check. * Check if sockets are exstablished to rabbitm/database services Usage example for octavia: # python generic-health-probe.py --config-file /etc/octavia/octavia.conf \ # --process-name octavia-health-manager # --probe-type liveness # --config-file /etc/octavia/octavia.conf # --check database_sockets --check rabbitmq_sockets """ import os import psutil import socket import sys from urllib import parse from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_context import context from oslo_log import log from oslo_db import options as db_opts from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import utils as db_utils import oslo_messaging rpc_timeout = int(os.getenv('RPC_PROBE_TIMEOUT', '60')) rpc_retries = int(os.getenv('RPC_PROBE_RETRIES', '2')) rabbit_port = 5672 mysql_port = 3306 tcp_established = "ESTABLISHED" log.logging.basicConfig(level=log.INFO) log.register_options(cfg.CONF) LOG = log.getLogger(__file__) def get_rabbitmq_ports(): "Get RabbitMQ ports" rabbitmq_ports = set() try: transport_url = oslo_messaging.TransportURL.parse(cfg.CONF) for host in transport_url.hosts: rabbitmq_ports.add(host.port) except Exception as ex: rabbitmq_ports.add(rabbit_port) message = getattr(ex, "message", str(ex)) LOG.info("Health probe caught exception reading " "RabbitMQ ports: %s", message) return rabbitmq_ports def get_database_ports(): "Get Database ports" db_opts.set_defaults(cfg.CONF) connection = parse.urlparse(cfg.CONF.database.connection) if not connection: LOG.info("Skippingg probe can't find database ports") return True host = db_utils.get_db_connection_info(connection)[3] port = host.split(':')[1] or 3306 return [int(port)] def is_connected_to(process_name, ports): for pr in psutil.pids(): try: p = psutil.Process(pr) if any(process_name in cmd for cmd in p.cmdline()): pcon = p.connections() for con in pcon: try: port = con.raddr[1] status = con.status except IndexError: continue if port in ports and status == tcp_established: return True except psutil.NoSuchProcess: continue def is_connected_to_rabbitmq(): """Check if the tcp socket to rabbitmq is in Established state""" proc = cfg.CONF.process_name ports = get_rabbitmq_ports() if not is_connected_to(proc, ports): LOG.error("RabbitMQ sockets not Established") return False return True def is_connected_to_database(): """Check if the tcp socket to database is in Established state""" proc = cfg.CONF.process_name ports = get_database_ports() if not is_connected_to(proc, ports): LOG.error("Mysql sockets not Established") return False return True if __name__ == "__main__": cfg.CONF.register_cli_opt(cfg.StrOpt('probe-type', required=True, choices=['liveness', 'readiness'])) cfg.CONF.register_cli_opt(cfg.StrOpt('process-name', required=True)) cfg.CONF.register_cli_opt(cfg.MultiStrOpt('check', default=['database_sockets', 'rabbitmq_sockets'])) cfg.CONF(sys.argv[1:]) if 'database_sockets' in cfg.CONF.check: if not is_connected_to_database(): LOG.error("Connection to database is not established.") sys.exit(1) if 'rabbitmq_sockets' in cfg.CONF.check: if not is_connected_to_rabbitmq(): LOG.error("Connection to rabbitmq is not established.") sys.exit(1)

commit_message:
add tempest config

This patch add fixed_network_name in tempest config and
standard-attr-tag in tempest network-feature-enabled:api_extensions.

Change-Id: I305fddb5ee04c6b1c4ba71a4f054bb3cdcb2546b

subject: Use ceph-mgr prometheus module default settings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-11 20:53:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/940a7470c823afa74547e426c8b979cad5a4f3ea', 'message': "Use ceph-mgr prometheus module default settings

This updates the ceph-client chart to use the default settings
for the address and port for the ceph-mgr prometheus module. As
multiple ceph-mgr replicas result in an active/standby deployment,
explicitly setting the exporter address to 0.0.0.0 results in
unexpected behavior. This is because by default, the module will
configure all prometheus module exporter's addresses to the
active mgr's hostname, which allows any queries made to standby
ceph-mgrs to be routed to the active ceph-mgr instead, resulting
in expected behavior

Change-Id: Ibf5d1d3cd276188d730392483835c85ae9a46dba
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-11-12 14:24:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/672d5891de0e2d68ec7fa603554be96a87cf397f', 'message': "Use ceph-mgr prometheus module default settings

commit_message:
Use ceph-mgr prometheus module default settings

This updates the ceph-client chart to use the default settings
for the address and port for the ceph-mgr prometheus module. As
multiple ceph-mgr replicas result in an active/standby deployment,
explicitly setting the exporter address to 0.0.0.0 results in
unexpected behavior. This is because by default, the module will
configure all prometheus module exporter's addresses to the
active mgr's hostname, which allows any queries made to standby
ceph-mgrs to be routed to the active ceph-mgr instead, resulting
in expected behavior

Change-Id: Ibf5d1d3cd276188d730392483835c85ae9a46dba
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
[helm-toolkit] Add the replacement of illegal characters in _daemonset_overrides.tpl

In some scenarios, the label of node contains characters that Kubernetes resources name cannot tolerate, such as'/','_', and so on. In _ daemonset_overrides.tpl, the replacement of illegal characters has been added, that is, when rendering the metadata name of secret or daemonset, the illegal characters will be replaced with'-'.

Change-Id: If39a0909977f3bb882b2cd2f6ca4aa4c04442638

commit_message:
[DNM] Test of using .Files.Get vs include for script assets

Right now we use include for almost all scripts and fragments, many of
which do not need gotpl mangling and would be eaiser if left naked.

Change-Id: Iaa7dab07ace8520bc9a1d603026526c871fea864

commit_message:
Pass pip index environment variables to loci build

Currently the way to pass PIP_INDEX_URL and PIP_TRUSTED_HOST is to
pass proper base image that has corresponding environment variables,
however these variables will be part of environment of resulting image.
Instead, this commit adds these vars as build args for loci Dockerfile.

Change-Id: I90c217291f8d6a5dab84a60a90e98a2e8986421c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/loci refs/changes/13/709413/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: ARG PIP_INDEX_URL=https://pypi.python.org/simple/ ARG PIP_TRUSTED_HOST=pypi.python.org ENV PIP_INDEX_URL=${PIP_INDEX_URL} ENV PIP_TRUSTED_HOST=${PIP_TRUSTED_HOST}

commit_message:
Extract rendered scripts from configmap-bin.yaml

Extract scripts after configmap-bin.yaml rendering during 'tox -elint'
run to .yamllint/${CHART}/templates/bin directory for evaluation and
possible future processing.

Change-Id: I88debe46f6eaf87ef044c6a612e5c2cd29b0887d
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/35/740835/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TEMPLATES_DIR=${LINT_DIR}/$i/templates CONFIGMAP_BIN=${TEMPLATES_DIR}/configmap-bin.yaml [ ! -f ${CONFIGMAP_BIN} ] && continue mkdir -p ${TEMPLATES_DIR}/bin for i in $(yq '.data | keys[]' ${CONFIGMAP_BIN} 2>/dev/null); do echo -e $(yq ".data.$i" ${CONFIGMAP_BIN} 2>/dev/null) > ${TEMPLATES_DIR}/bin/${i//\"} done

commit_message:
Enable tty and stdin for containers in debug mode

With this commit by setting 'debug: true' in values, containers allocate
tty and stdin buffer, allowing to attach to running container and
use pdb with e.g.:

kubectl attach -nopenstack mariadb-server-0

Change-Id: I9bfebc60dfd84209d8b5680c8dd54b794eb65786

commit_message:
Checks replication status in the readiness probe.

If wsrep_ready is not ON. Then checks if the replication is in
progress and does not exit 1 if replication is in progress.

wsrep_ready = ON implies wsrep_local_state_comment = Synced
hence removed explicity check for Synced

Change-Id: If6ebc934ee31040c92ef39c0ac2f64d9060f74bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/69/742269/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[mariadb] Use service IP in cluster address

It was observed that under certain circumstances
galera instances can use old IP address of the node
after pod restart. This patch changes the value of
wsrep_cluster_address variable - instead of listing
all dns names of the cluster nodes the discovery service
IP address is used. In this case cluster_node_address is set to IP
address instead of DNS name - otherwise SST method will fail.

Change-Id: I4d05309b70e0eaee7ac126b5a36f3778439b5827
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/38/704038/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Get local node IP address local_ip = socket.gethostbyname(local_hostname) logger.info("This instance IP address: {0}".format(local_ip)) cluster_config_params['wsrep_node_address'] = local_ip if mode == 'run': cluster_config_params['wsrep_cluster_address'] = "gcomm://{0}:{1}".format( discovery_domain, wsrep_port)
deleted_lines: wsrep_node_address = "{0}.{1}:{2}".format( node_hostname, discovery_domain, wsrep_port) cluster_config_params['wsrep_node_address'] = wsrep_node_address else: addr = "{0}.{1}:{2}".format(node_hostname, discovery_domain, wsrep_port) wsrep_cluster_members.append(addr) if wsrep_cluster_members and mode == 'run': cluster_config_params['wsrep_cluster_address'] = "gcomm://{0}".format( ",".join(wsrep_cluster_members))

Change-Id: I12f83004ada437a603e86364ada9b99e86368ad8

commit_message:
Prometheus: change nova-compute disabled alert

Previously alerts complained about disabled compute nodes.
Compute nodes can be disabled in some cloud. Instead the alert should
focus on down compute hosts.

Change-Id: I12f83004ada437a603e86364ada9b99e86368ad8

added_lines: - alert: os_nova_compute_down expr: openstack_services_nova_compute_down_total > 0 description: 'nova-compute is down on certain hosts for more than 5 minutes' summary: 'Openstack compute service nova-compute is down on some hosts'

commit_message:
Add a rh-python36-mod_wsgi in bindep for rpm apache

Add apache's dependencies in bindep for ussuri openstack image.
The openstack image which is built from python3 environment needs
python3_mod_wsgi package if this image is going to install httpd/apache.
Legency mod_wsgi may not be suit for python3 environmrnt anymore.

Story: 2007671
Task: 39772

Change-Id: I5d6289b74a90204cd791907b5988cfe36e35f45d
Signed-off-by: Yu Chengde <yu.chengde@99cloud.com>

commit_message:
Add tempest job and gate to zuul as voting

Patches has been sent to fix the tempest job so
now that its working enable it voting for jobs and the gate

Also enable the experimental multinode-tempest job so
we can improve it in the future now that the base tempest
job is working

Change-Id: I6a02c3a348dc79dd6a579c5efa8fa8267c937156

commit_message:
Add glance metadefs to glance DB

To pass a specific tempest test,
glance DB should load "metadata definition service" in advance.

The specific api test is
"tempest.api.image.v2.test_images_metadefs_namespaces".

Change-Id: Id6f2a3aba2083d865bfb407ca7cfca5216c22db2

commit_message:
Dex: Initial Chart

This PS brings in a functional Dex Chart for use with
keystone. Currently due to dex limitations only web sso
is supported, future work should enable CLI use.

Change-Id: Ib1c8284a34de5a6a3638bd3756153d6e5b47af11
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
CI: Disable libvirt debug logs

Libvirt debug logs can grow very large, particularly on Ubuntu (we have
seen up to 1.1GB). Disable libvirt debug logging using variable
nova_libvirt_logging_debug which was added to Kolla Ansible during the
Wallaby cycle (see change I90bfd1b300ad3202ea4d139fda6d6beb44c5820f) and
backported to Victoria and Ussuri.

Change-Id: Ic047e80aa382148b009b1c03581b417d17ec2598
(cherry picked from commit f09faa43d1a1d38b30967cce948af6b60c34be70)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/00/811500/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Reduce size of libvirt logs when OpenStack debug logging is enabled nova_libvirt_logging_debug: False

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-22 08:35:51.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_setup/main.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent/commit/a4e533e5404c48d5b4b92574318660c91896f70e', 'message': 'Add a condition for systemd service detection in monasca_setup

Skip agent service detection if only installing plugins.
This will make it possible to use monasca-setup on the environments

Change-Id: Ide5aee0cdd65bc6954296b995e61d395be8e9603
'}]
commit_message:
Add a condition for systemd service detection in monasca_setup

Skip agent service detection if only installing plugins.
This will make it possible to use monasca-setup on the environments
 where monasca-agent is not running as systemd service.
Typical usecase is running agent on kubernetes.

Change-Id: Ide5aee0cdd65bc6954296b995e61d395be8e9603
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/71/810371/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not args.install_plugins_only: agent_service = detect_init(PREFIX_DIR, args.config_dir, args.log_dir, args.template_dir, username=args.user, name=args.agent_service_name)
deleted_lines: agent_service = detect_init(PREFIX_DIR, args.config_dir, args.log_dir, args.template_dir, username=args.user, name=args.agent_service_name)

commit_message:
Add support for apt proxy setting

Add support for configuring apt's proxy setting on Ubuntu hosts.

Change-Id: Iea1daff70fca5cf49f4e7f44af71a900678bb5c9
Story: 2009035
Task: 42782

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- charm-helpers sync for new charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

Change-Id: I1dadd96087714bf5a88f324d615d2c3126f66690

commit_message:
Deploy source type images by default

Source images get the most test coverage, so it makes sense to deploy
these by default.

Change-Id: I8d0c8750e2c1600e84cc2e677a4eae0e9f502dac

commit_message:
Add section for 'nova-manage placement audit' tool

The 'nova-manage placement audit' tool has functionality that can
delete orphaned allocations in placement. Add a section for it in the
doc for troubleshooting orphaned allocations.

Change-Id: I697de57cf7eb43c0993af2b1f5b3f5c4395ef097
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/809479/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Using placement audit ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ If you have a situation where orphaned allocations exist for an instance that was deleted in the past, example log message: .. code-block:: console Instance <uuid> has allocations against this compute host but is not found in the database. you can use the :program`nova-manage placement audit` tool to have it find and optionally delete orphaned placement allocations. This tool will call the placement API to modify allocations. To list all allocations that are unrelated to an existing instance or migration UUID: .. code-block:: console $ nova-manage placement audit --verbose To delete all allocations on all resource providers that are unrelated to an existing instance or migration UUID: .. code-block:: console $ nova-manage placement audit --verbose --delete To delete all allocations on a specific resource provider that are unrelated to an existing instance or migration UUID: $ nova-manage placement audit --verbose --delete --resource-provider <uuid>

commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1944759

Add functional tests to reproduce the race between resize_instance()
and update_available_resources().

Related-Bug: #1944759

Change-Id: Icb7e3379248fe00f9a94f9860181b5de44902379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/810763/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_resize_bug_1944759(self): self.flags( cpu_dedicated_set='0-3', cpu_shared_set='4-7', group='compute') self.flags(vcpu_pin_set=None) # start services self.start_compute(hostname='test_compute0') self.start_compute(hostname='test_compute1') flavor_a_id = self._create_flavor( vcpu=2, extra_spec={'hw:cpu_policy': 'dedicated'}) server = self._create_server(flavor_id=flavor_a_id) # we don't really care what the new flavor is, so long as the old # flavor is using pinning. We use a similar flavor for simplicity. flavor_b_id = self._create_flavor( vcpu=2, extra_spec={'hw:cpu_policy': 'dedicated'}) orig_rpc_finish_resize = nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI.finish_resize # Simulate that the finish_resize call overlaps with an # update_available_resource periodic job def inject_periodic_to_finish_resize(*args, **kwargs): self._run_periodics() return orig_rpc_finish_resize(*args, **kwargs) self.stub_out( 'nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI.finish_resize', inject_periodic_to_finish_resize, ) # TODO(stephenfin): The mock of 'migrate_disk_and_power_off' should # probably be less...dumb with mock.patch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver' '.migrate_disk_and_power_off', return_value='{}', ): post = {'resize': {'flavorRef': flavor_b_id}} self.api.post_server_action(server['id'], post) server = self._wait_for_state_change(server, 'VERIFY_RESIZE') # Now confirm the resize post = {'confirmResize': None} # FIXME(gibi): This is bug 1944759 where during resize, on the source # node the resize_instance() call at the point of calling finish_resize # overlaps with a update_available_resources() periodic job. This # causes that the periodic job will not track the migration nor the # instance and therefore freeing the resource allocation. Then when # later the resize is confirmed the confirm_resize on the source # compute also wants to free up the resources, the pinned CPUs, and it # fails as they are already freed. exc = self.assertRaises( client.OpenStackApiException, self.api.post_server_action, server['id'], post ) self.assertEqual(500, exc.response.status_code) self.assertIn('CPUUnpinningInvalid', str(exc))

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-30 13:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['interface_tls_certificates/ca_client.py', 'test/test_ca_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ops-interface-tls-certificates/commit/7686150befd27602a02dbb526260ac0c0c75a71a', 'message': "Enable interface use in CMR contexts

In cross model relation contexts, the unit name on the consuming
side of the relation is obfuscated by Juju.  Explicitly set the

Change-Id: Iae93521bc4a3d899560ac304e7b98bfd1d282709
"}]
commit_message:
Enable interface use in CMR contexts

In cross model relation contexts, the unit name on the consuming
side of the relation is obfuscated by Juju.  Explicitly set the
name of the unit on the relation so providing service can use
this as the key when returning a specific unit's cert and key
for TLS encryption.

Change-Id: Iae93521bc4a3d899560ac304e7b98bfd1d282709
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ops-interface-tls-certificates refs/changes/57/811957/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow LVM filter to work when either allowlist or denylist are empty

Fixes the LVM filter task for it to build correctly formatted lists
when either one of allowlist or denylist are empty.

Change-Id: I3ebd492455462420cac2ed6b0c30d2758225abec
Closes-Bug: 1944743
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/14/810714/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: lvm2_allow_list: "{{ allowed_devices | map('regex_replace', '(.+)', 'a|\\1|') }}" lvm2_deny_list: "{{ tripleo_tripleo_lvmfilter_devices_denylist | default([]) | map('regex_replace', '(.+)', 'r|\\1|') }}" lvm2_filter: "\"{{ (lvm2_allow_list + lvm2_deny_list) | join('\",\"') }}\""
deleted_lines: lvm2_allow_list: "\"{{ allowed_devices | map('regex_replace', '(.+)', 'a|\\1|') | join('\",\"') }}\"" lvm2_deny_list: "\"{{ tripleo_tripleo_lvmfilter_devices_denylist | default([]) | map('regex_replace', '(.+)', 'r|\\1|') | join('\",\"') }}\"" lvm2_filter: "{{ lvm2_allow_list + ',' + lvm2_deny_list }}"

commit_message:
ovs-agent: Report pkt processing info in heartbeat

OVS agent configuration is extended to support new configuration
options:
  - 'resource_provider_packet_processing_without_direction'
  - 'resource_provider_packet_processing_with_direction'
  - 'resource_provider_packet_processing_inventory_defaults'

OVS agent RPC hearthbeat now reports this information to neutron
server in 'configuration' field .

Example config:

ml2_conf.ini:
[ovs]
resource_provider_packet_processing_with_direction = :1000:1000

Partial-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: Ief554bc445dfd93ea6995bb42b4d010674c7a091
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/44/800444/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_configurations_has_rp_pp_without_direction(self): self.assertIn(n_const.RP_PP_WITHOUT_DIRECTION, self.agent.agent_state['configurations']) def test_configurations_has_rp_pp_with_direction(self): self.assertIn(n_const.RP_PP_WITH_DIRECTION, self.agent.agent_state['configurations']) def test_configurations_has_rp_pp_default_inventory(self): self.assertIn(n_const.RP_PP_INVENTORY_DEFAULTS, self.agent.agent_state['configurations']) rp_inv_defaults = \ self.agent.agent_state['configurations'][ n_const.RP_INVENTORY_DEFAULTS] self.assertListEqual( sorted(['reserved', 'min_unit', 'allocation_ratio', 'step_size']), sorted(list(rp_inv_defaults))) self.assertEqual(1.0, rp_inv_defaults['allocation_ratio']) self.assertEqual(1, rp_inv_defaults['min_unit']) self.assertEqual(1, rp_inv_defaults['step_size']) self.assertEqual(0, rp_inv_defaults['reserved']) def test__validate_rp_pkt_processing_cfg(self): cfg.CONF.set_override(n_const.RP_PP_WITHOUT_DIRECTION, [':0'], 'OVS') cfg.CONF.set_override(n_const.RP_PP_WITH_DIRECTION, [':0:0'], 'OVS') self.assertRaises(ValueError, self._make_agent)

Final RC patch for ec2-api

This creates a new RC before the final release candidate deadline to
release the latest fixes and/or translations.

Please ack with a +1, or if there is some reason to hold off, leave a -1.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 30.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 13.0.0.0rc1..183397a
183397a remove lower-constraints job. it's buggy
b281f31 Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7
e6e1ab3 update aws ec2 interface
e6f4c30 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena
0154083 update .gitreview

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add BFD monitor operations

Change-Id: Ifb41fab7a7f45f1a90e8463bcce59fd59ba6da84
Related-Bug: #1907089
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/78/810078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack.network.v2 import bfd as _bfd def create_bfd_monitor(self, **attrs): """Create a new BFD monitor from attributes :param dict attrs: Keyword arguments which will be used to create a :class:`~openstack.network.v2.bfd.BFDMonitor, comprised of the properties on the BFDMonitor class. :returns: The results of BFD monitor creation :rtype: :class:`~openstack.network.v2.bfd.BFDMonitor` """ return self._create(_bfd.BFDMonitor, **attrs) def delete_bfd_monitor(self, bfd_monitor, ignore_missing=True): """Delete a BFD monitor """ self._delete(_bfd.BFDMonitor, bfd_monitor, ignore_missing=ignore_missing) def find_bfd_monitor(self, name_or_id, ignore_missing=True, **args): """Find a single BFD monitor """ return self._find(_bfd.BFDMonitor, name_or_id, ignore_missing=ignore_missing, **args) def get_bfd_monitor(self, bfd_monitor): """Get a single BFD monitor """ return self._get(_bfd.BFDMonitor, bfd_monitor) def bfd_monitors(self, **query): """"Return a generator of BFD monitors """ return self._list(_bfd.BFDMonitor, **query) def get_bfd_session_status(self, bfd_monitor): """Get BFD monitor session status """ bfd_monitor = self._get_resource(_bfd.BFDMonitor, bfd_monitor) return bfd_monitor.get_bfd_session_status(self) def get_bfd_monitor_associations(self, bfd_monitor): """Get BFD monitor associations """ bfd_monitor = self._get_resource(_bfd.BFDMonitor, bfd_monitor) return bfd_monitor.get_bfd_monitor_associations(self)

subject: Add API extension for QoS minimum pps rule
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-30 14:38:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/55fcc24b1b832caa7232bf4e7110f4a32d1c5c56', 'message': "Add API extenstion for QoS minimum pps rule

This patch implements support for CRUD operations for QoS minimum
packet rate. The new rule is accesible through old-style API where
policy_id has to be provided in the URI:

DELETE /qos/policies/$POLICY_ID/minimum_packet_rate_rules/$RULE_ID

or with new-style API:

DELETE /qos/minimum_packet_rate_rules/$RULE_ID

Keep in mind that new-style doesn't use 'alias_' prefix, as opposed to
other QoS rule aliases.

Placement or dataplane enforcement is not implemented yet.
New-style API is not covered with UTs.

commit_message:
Add API extension for QoS minimum pps rule

This patch implements support for CRUD operations for QoS minimum
packet rate, for example:

DELETE /qos/policies/$POLICY_ID/minimum_packet_rate_rules/$RULE_ID

Placement or dataplane enforcement is not implemented yet.

Partial-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: Ie994bdab62bab33737f25287e568519c782dea9a

Drop ansible-playbook-3 workarounds

This code was necessary when doing the python2/python3 transition but is
no longer required.

commit_message:
Restart radosgw services on upgrade

When radosgw packages are upgraded, the radosgw service needs to
be restarted by the charm. Check to see that packages were installed
on the upgrade path and if so, restart the radosgw service.

Change-Id: I61055ea4605a9a7c490c18f611d0eb583c617ce3
Closes-Bug: #1906707

commit_message:
[ovn] metadata functional tests don't support Chassis_Private

This adds support to test_metadata_agent tests for OVN versions
that have the Chassis_Private table.

Closes-Bug: 1944460
Change-Id: If4e24dd933c0efbb793ed6082c59db0435833389

commit_message:
Build source type images by default

Source images get the most test coverage, so it makes sense to build
these by default.

commit_message:
Fix create_notification unittest and bump lower-constraints

- The method create_notification returns an uuid string, if it isn't
mocked the 'notification's id' will be:

<MagicMock name='NotificationsRepository().create_notification()'

which can't be dump to json later.

- Bump Mako to 1.0.7 in lower-constraints.txt
- Bump decorator to 4.1.0 in lower-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I1ba563fd3144241127efe1cedf8853603dcca008

commit_message:
Constraints jsonschema to version lower than 4.0.0

This patch aim to unlock our validation before spending
more time to fix the following traceback:

```
+ yamllint -f parsable -c ./yamllint.yml deliverables/victoria deliverables/wallaby deliverables/xena deliverables/_independent
validate run-test: commands[1] | /home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/tools/tox-log-command.sh check-schema
setting PATH=/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/.tox/validate/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games:/snap/bin

Logging check-schema output to /home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/.tox/validate/log/check-schema-results.log

Traceback (most recent call last):

    sys.exit(main())
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/openstack_releases/cmds/check_schema.py", line 103, in main
    errors.extend(
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/openstack_releases/cmds/check_schema.py", line 66, in validate_one_file
    validator = make_validator_with_date(schema_data)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/openstack_releases/cmds/check_schema.py", line 58, in make_validator_with_date
    return jsonschema.validators.extend(
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'types'
ERROR: InvocationError for command /home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/releases/tools/tox-log-command.sh check-schema (exited with code 1)
```

commit_message:
Bump up Ansible supported versions

This change bumps up the maximum supported Ansible version to 4.x
(ansible-core 2.11.x) and minimum to 2.10. This synchronises Kayobe with
Kolla Ansible (see change I8b9212934dfab3831986e8db55671baee32f4bbd).

Uses of docker_image are updated. We must now provide the source
parameter. When source is build (for molecule), we replace force by
force_source and force_tag and move path and dockerfile under the build
parameter.

Use docker_image_info instead of docker_image_facts.

Handle update of ansible inside kolla-ansible virtualenv and document
how to do it for the kayobe virtualenv.

Change-Id: I7a4530f4f63ddb37aa30a617db5944b97bc3e17f

commit_message:
[CI] Test instance health after upgrade

Just like I added Cinder volume upgrade testing before, let's
also test similarly for Nova and Neutron. :-)

More robust debugging and refactor included.

Related-Bug: #1941706
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/806476
Change-Id: Id79df44254603f9b37ce7da2bfc796fc0b1ac91f
(cherry picked from commit daf534b4e0b7fd07a87cd9bde2731836ee40574c)

added_lines: <<<<<<< HEAD (540a36 Merge "Check config when checking the containers" into stabl)======= function create_a_volume { local volume_name=$1 local attempt openstack volume create --size 2 $volume_name attempt=1 while [[ $(openstack volume show $volume_name -f value -c status) != "available" ]]; do echo "Volume $volume_name not available yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Volume $volume_name failed to become available" openstack volume show $volume_name return 1 fi sleep 10 done } function attach_and_detach_a_volume { local volume_name=$1 local instance_name=$2 local attempt openstack server add volume $instance_name $volume_name --device /dev/vdb attempt=1 while [[ $(openstack volume show $volume_name -f value -c status) != "in-use" ]]; do echo "Volume $volume_name not attached yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Volume failed to attach" openstack volume show $volume_name return 1 fi sleep 10 done openstack server remove volume $instance_name $volume_name attempt=1 while [[ $(openstack volume show $volume_name -f value -c status) != "available" ]]; do echo "Volume $volume_name not detached yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Volume failed to detach" openstack volume show $volume_name return 1 fi sleep 10 done } function delete_a_volume { local volume_name=$1 local attempt local result openstack volume delete $volume_name attempt=1 # NOTE(yoctozepto): This is executed outside of the `while` clause # *on purpose*. You see, bash is evil (TM) and will silence any error # happening in any "condition" clause (such as `if` or `while`) even with # `errexit` being set. result=$(openstack volume list --name $volume_name -f value -c ID) while [[ -n "$result" ]]; do echo "Volume $volume_name not deleted yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Volume failed to delete" openstack volume show $volume_name return 1 fi sleep 10 result=$(openstack volume list --name $volume_name -f value -c ID) done } function create_instance { local name=$1 openstack server create --wait --image cirros --flavor m1.tiny --key-name mykey --network demo-net ${name} >>>>>>> CHANGE (5810d5 [CI] Test instance health after upgrade) if [[ $(openstack server show ${name} -f value -c status) != "ACTIVE" ]]; then openstack --debug server show ${name}} function delete_instance { local name=$1 openstack server delete --wait ${name} } function create_fip { openstack floating ip create public1 -f value -c floating_ip_address } function delete_fip { local fip_addr=$1 openstack floating ip delete ${fip_addr} } function attach_fip { local instance_name=$1 local fip_addr=$2 openstack server add floating ip ${instance_name} ${fip_addr} } function detach_fip { local instance_name=$1 local fip_addr=$2 openstack server remove floating ip ${instance_name} ${fip_addr} } function test_ssh { local instance_name=$1 local fip_addr=$2 local attempts attempts=12 for i in $(seq 1 ${attempts}); do if ping -c1 -W1 ${fip_addr} && ssh -v -o BatchMode=yes -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no cirros@${fip_addr} hostname; then break elif [[ $i -eq ${attempts} ]]; then echo "Failed to access server via SSH after ${attempts} attempts" echo "Console log:" openstack console log show ${instance_name} || true openstack --debug server show ${instance_name} return 1 else echo "Cannot access server - retrying" fi sleep 10 done } function test_instance_boot { local fip_addr echo "TESTING: Server creation" create_instance kolla_boot_test fip_addr=$(create_fip) attach_fip kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} test_ssh kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} detach_fip kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} delete_fip ${fip_addr} delete_instance kolla_boot_test if [[ $HAS_UPGRADE == 'yes' ]]; then echo "TESTING: Instance (Nova and Neutron) upgrade stability (PHASE: $PHASE)" if [[ $PHASE == 'deploy' ]]; then create_instance kolla_upgrade_test fip_addr=$(create_fip) attach_fip kolla_upgrade_test ${fip_addr} test_ssh kolla_upgrade_test ${fip_addr} # tested to see if the instance has not just failed booting already echo ${fip_addr} > /tmp/kolla_ci_pre_upgrade_fip_addr elif [[ $PHASE == 'upgrade' ]]; then fip_addr=$(cat /tmp/kolla_ci_pre_upgrade_fip_addr) test_ssh kolla_upgrade_test ${fip_addr} detach_fip kolla_upgrade_test ${fip_addr} delete_fip ${fip_addr} delete_instance kolla_upgrade_test fi echo "SUCCESS: Instance (Nova and Neutron) upgrade stability (PHASE: $PHASE)" fi
deleted_lines: if [[ $(openstack server show kolla_boot_test -f value -c status) != "ACTIVE" ]]; then openstack --debug server show kolla_boot_test fip_addr=$(openstack floating ip create public1 -f value -c floating_ip_address) openstack server add floating ip kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} attempts=12 for i in $(seq 1 ${attempts}); do if ping -c1 -W1 ${fip_addr} && ssh -v -o BatchMode=yes -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no cirros@${fip_addr} hostname; then break elif [[ $i -eq ${attempts} ]]; then echo "Failed to access server via SSH after ${attempts} attempts" echo "Console log:" openstack console log show kolla_boot_test return 1 else echo "Cannot access server - retrying" fi sleep 10 done openstack server remove floating ip kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} openstack floating ip delete ${fip_addr} openstack server delete --wait kolla_boot_test

commit_message:
[CI] Cinder upgrade testing

To gain visibility into how our upgrades affect existing Cinder
volumes, a new testing path is required.
This patch adds it.

Additionally, it refactors the repeated actions and ensures that
we wait for volume deletions as well.

Change-Id: Ic08d461e6fdf91c378a87860765a489c2f86d690
Related-Bug: #1904062
(cherry picked from commit 62b8c6b68413330da032d14b45c6fbd340ec9e2d)

added_lines: function create_a_volume { local volume_name=$1 local attempt openstack volume create --size 2 $volume_name attempt=1 while [[ $(openstack volume show $volume_name -f value -c status) != "available" ]]; do echo "Volume $volume_name not available yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Volume $volume_name failed to become available" openstack volume show $volume_name return 1 fi sleep 10 done } function attach_and_detach_a_volume { local volume_name=$1 local instance_name=$2 local attempt openstack server add volume $instance_name $volume_name --device /dev/vdb attempt=1 while [[ $(openstack volume show $volume_name -f value -c status) != "in-use" ]]; do echo "Volume $volume_name not attached yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Volume failed to attach" openstack volume show $volume_name return 1 fi sleep 10 done openstack server remove volume $instance_name $volume_name attempt=1 while [[ $(openstack volume show $volume_name -f value -c status) != "available" ]]; do echo "Volume $volume_name not detached yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Volume failed to detach" openstack volume show $volume_name return 1 fi sleep 10 done } function delete_a_volume { local volume_name=$1 local attempt local result openstack volume delete $volume_name attempt=1 # NOTE(yoctozepto): This is executed outside of the `while` clause # *on purpose*. You see, bash is evil (TM) and will silence any error # happening in any "condition" clause (such as `if` or `while`) even with # `errexit` being set. result=$(openstack volume list --name $volume_name -f value -c ID) while [[ -n "$result" ]]; do echo "Volume $volume_name not deleted yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Volume failed to delete" openstack volume show $volume_name return 1 fi sleep 10 result=$(openstack volume list --name $volume_name -f value -c ID) done } create_a_volume test_volume openstack volume show test_volume attach_and_detach_a_volume test_volume kolla_boot_test delete_a_volume test_volume if [[ $HAS_UPGRADE == 'yes' ]]; then echo "TESTING: Cinder volume upgrade stability (PHASE: $PHASE)" if [[ $PHASE == 'deploy' ]]; then create_a_volume durable_volume openstack volume show durable_volume elif [[ $PHASE == 'upgrade' ]]; then openstack volume show durable_volume attach_and_detach_a_volume durable_volume kolla_boot_test delete_a_volume durable_volume fi echo "SUCCESS: Cinder volume upgrade stability (PHASE: $PHASE)" fi

commit_message:
[CI] Test instance health after upgrade

Just like I added Cinder volume upgrade testing before, let's
also test similarly for Nova and Neutron. :-)

More robust debugging and refactor included.

Related-Bug: #1941706
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/806476
Change-Id: Id79df44254603f9b37ce7da2bfc796fc0b1ac91f
(cherry picked from commit daf534b4e0b7fd07a87cd9bde2731836ee40574c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/83/806383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function create_instance { local name=$1 openstack server create --wait --image cirros --flavor m1.tiny --key-name mykey --network demo-net ${name} if [[ $(openstack server show ${name} -f value -c status) != "ACTIVE" ]]; then openstack --debug server show ${name}} function delete_instance { local name=$1 openstack server delete --wait ${name} } function create_fip { openstack floating ip create public1 -f value -c floating_ip_address } function delete_fip { local fip_addr=$1 openstack floating ip delete ${fip_addr} } function attach_fip { local instance_name=$1 local fip_addr=$2 openstack server add floating ip ${instance_name} ${fip_addr} } function detach_fip { local instance_name=$1 local fip_addr=$2 openstack server remove floating ip ${instance_name} ${fip_addr} } function test_ssh { local instance_name=$1 local fip_addr=$2 local attempts attempts=12 for i in $(seq 1 ${attempts}); do if ping -c1 -W1 ${fip_addr} && ssh -v -o BatchMode=yes -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no cirros@${fip_addr} hostname; then break elif [[ $i -eq ${attempts} ]]; then echo "Failed to access server via SSH after ${attempts} attempts" echo "Console log:" openstack console log show ${instance_name} || true openstack --debug server show ${instance_name} return 1 else echo "Cannot access server - retrying" fi sleep 10 done } function test_instance_boot { local fip_addr echo "TESTING: Server creation" create_instance kolla_boot_test fip_addr=$(create_fip) attach_fip kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} test_ssh kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} detach_fip kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} delete_fip ${fip_addr} delete_instance kolla_boot_test if [[ $HAS_UPGRADE == 'yes' ]]; then echo "TESTING: Instance (Nova and Neutron) upgrade stability (PHASE: $PHASE)" if [[ $PHASE == 'deploy' ]]; then create_instance kolla_upgrade_test fip_addr=$(create_fip) attach_fip kolla_upgrade_test ${fip_addr} test_ssh kolla_upgrade_test ${fip_addr} # tested to see if the instance has not just failed booting already echo ${fip_addr} > /tmp/kolla_ci_pre_upgrade_fip_addr elif [[ $PHASE == 'upgrade' ]]; then fip_addr=$(cat /tmp/kolla_ci_pre_upgrade_fip_addr) test_ssh kolla_upgrade_test ${fip_addr} detach_fip kolla_upgrade_test ${fip_addr} delete_fip ${fip_addr} delete_instance kolla_upgrade_test fi echo "SUCCESS: Instance (Nova and Neutron) upgrade stability (PHASE: $PHASE)" fi
deleted_lines: function test_instance_boot { echo "TESTING: Server creation" openstack server create --wait --image cirros --flavor m1.tiny --key-name mykey --network demo-net kolla_boot_test openstack --debug server list if [[ $(openstack server show kolla_boot_test -f value -c status) != "ACTIVE" ]]; then openstack --debug server show kolla_boot_test fip_addr=$(openstack floating ip create public1 -f value -c floating_ip_address) openstack server add floating ip kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} attempts=12 for i in $(seq 1 ${attempts}); do if ping -c1 -W1 ${fip_addr} && ssh -v -o BatchMode=yes -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no cirros@${fip_addr} hostname; then break elif [[ $i -eq ${attempts} ]]; then echo "Failed to access server via SSH after ${attempts} attempts" echo "Console log:" openstack console log show kolla_boot_test return 1 else echo "Cannot access server - retrying" fi sleep 10 done openstack server remove floating ip kolla_boot_test ${fip_addr} openstack floating ip delete ${fip_addr} openstack server delete --wait kolla_boot_test

added_lines: // Copyright 2021 99cloud // // Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); // you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. // You may obtain a copy of the License at // // http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 // // Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software // distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, // WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. // See the License for the specific language governing permissions and // limitations under the License. import { ConfirmAction } from 'containers/Action'; import globalServerStore from 'stores/nova/instance'; export default class RevertResizeAction extends ConfirmAction { get id() { return 'revert_resize_migrate'; } get title() { return t('Revert Resize or Migrate'); } get buttonText() { return t('Revert Resize or Migrate'); } get actionName() { return t('revert resize or migrate'); } policy = 'os_compute_api:servers:resize'; allowedCheckFunc = (item) => { if (!item) { return true; } return item.status.toLowerCase() === 'verify_resize'; }; onSubmit = (item) => { const { id } = item || this.item; return globalServerStore.update(id, { revertResize: null, }); }; }
